form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Heitkamp (for herself and Mr. King) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify the definition of large employer for purposes of applying the employer mandate.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Small Business Stability Act.

section.header: Modification of large employer definition for purposes of the employer mandate

subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 4980H(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking 50 full-time employees and inserting 101 full-time employees; and

clause.text: by striking 50 full-time employees each place it appears and inserting 100 full-time employees; and
in subclause (II), by striking in excess of 50 and inserting in excess of 100; and

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:

clause.header: Eligible to purchase in small group market

subclause.text: This section shall not apply to a small employer that is eligible to purchase a qualified health plan in the small group health insurance market.
In this clause, the terms small employer and small group market shall have the meanings given such terms in section 1304 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to months beginning after December 31, 2013.
